sub_title: conceptual art, social art practice, research, art education
summary:
About text LinkedIn

Margret Wibmer was born in Lienz, Austria. After her studies at the University of Applied Arts in Vienna, she spent a large part of the 1980s in New York, a period that significantly formed her life and artistic practice. In 1990 she moved to Amsterdam where she is based since. Using various media such as photography, performance, video, interactive media and sculpture, she explores the human body and its situatedness within a social, cultural, historic, physical and digital context. An integral part of her work is the use of objects and handmade textile props as tools for creating relations.

Wibmer has exhibited and performed internationally in galleries and at venues such as Palais de Tokyo, Paris, France (2016); RMIT Design Hub, Melbourne, Australia (2015); Oude Kerk, Amsterdam, Netherlands (2015); Ishikawa Nishida Kitaro Museum of Philosophy, Japan (2013;) / KAI 10 – Arthena Foundation, Düsseldorf, Germany (2012); Centro per l’arte contemporanea Luigi Pecci, Prato, Italy (2006); Fashion Moda Gallery, South Bronx, USA (1988). Her work is included in public and private art collections. 
She has been the recipient of grants and fellowships by Pollock Krasner Foundation, Mondriaan Fonds, Fonds BKVB, Prins Bernhard Cultuur Fonds, Thijlfonds, Stichting Stokroos, Fonds Kwadraat, Bundeskanzleramt Österreich, Land Tirol, Fohn Stiftung and the Austrian Embassy. 

She has been teaching in art collages in Europe, US, Australia and Korea, most recently at NAFA in Singapore. Since 2012 she is advising non-EU students at the Dutch Art Institute a.k.a. DAI Roaming Academy. 

She studied Fine Arts at the University of Applied Arts in Vienna and has earned a Master of the Arts Degree in Design from Sandberg Institute in Amsterdam. 

www.margretwibmer.eu
www.dutchartinstitute.eu

awards.title: Preis für zeitgenössische Kunst
awards.description: Every year the cultural department of the province of Tyrol/Austria gives an award to a contemporary artist for his/her achievements in the field.

projects.title: TIME OUT
projects.description:
TIME OUT aimed at connecting visitors of the Oude Kerk with the church as historic monument through a conscious extension of the process of perception through which the familiar body-space experience is invalidated. The interaction takes place through shift of predictable behavior.

A new edition of TIME OUT is currently in preparation for the exhibition Fashion and Performance: Materiality, Meaning, Media which will take place from 5 March - 11 April 2015 at RMIT Design Hub in Melbourne, Australia.

contributors.headline: conceptual art, social art practice, research, art education

projects.title: Mbassy Unlimited introduces 'conversations with artists'
projects.description:
Mbassy Unlimited  introduces emerging visual artists who's work engenders multiple disciplines and areas of knowledge, while inventing or adapting new production methods. 

It is from these artists’ viewpoint as inquisitive minds, who dare to negotiate their position regardless of the art canon and the art market steered by commercial interests, that we can experience and gain understanding of changes in today's society.

'conversations with artists' are local art experiences for small groups, that provide expertise and tools for looking at contemporary art in a friendly and informal atmosphere.  

Our first event was organized in collaboration with the Austrian Embassy and took place on November 25th 2013. Meanwhile 'conversations with artists' has been picked up with much enthousiasm by GEMAK.org and several European Embassies located in The Hague.

contributors.headline: conceptual art, social art practice, research, art education

profile_positions.description: Margret Wibmer’s conceptual practice explores relations between bodies, objects and spaces. Using ambiguity and the principle of chance as a methodology to deconstruct internalized processes, norms and values deeply embedded within our societies, she creates transient ‘realities’ that explore new strategies for connecting us with the world and with others.Her works have been exhibited and performed at Palais de Tokyo in Paris, RMIT Design Hub Melbourne, Oude Kerk in Amsterdam, Nishida Kitaro Museum of Philosophy in Japan, Kunstpavillon Innsbruck, KAI 10 – Arthena Foundation in Düsseldorf, Lumen Travo Gallery, Bradwolff Projects, Movement Exposed Gallery Space and many other venues. Wibmer is adjunct lecturer at Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts (NAFA) in Singapore since 2021 and joined the US based Institute for Cultural Activism International as a performer and board member in 2022.
profile_positions.title: conceptual artist, photographer, educator

company.name: Dutch Art Institute a.k.a. DAI Roaming Academy

profile_positions.description: Advices and assists non-EU students on funding raising, practical matters and alleviating culture shock. As a fundraiser she works together with the Dutch Art Institute and others on funding solutions for outstanding and exceptionally motivated emerging artists, notably from 'low-income economies', who are yearning to study at DAI, have been enthusiastically accepted but find themselves debilitated by the higher tuition fees, the higher costs of living and the financial guarantee due in order to register in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Advisor International Students

profile_positions.description:
AIAS was a (purposely) small, independent and interdependent global organisation of art and design schools. AIAS was a platform that actively encourages mutual understanding, tolerance, freedom of speech. Art and design are fundamental creative forces that could shape the world to a better one.
As chief ambassador and a representative of ArtEZ University of the Arts, I was responsible for the development of international workshops for students and teachers. I was co-organizer of workshops at Kaywon School of Art and Design in Seoul, Marmara Univeristy in Istanbul, Univeristy of Evora, among others. (Pt) Responsible for maintaining and activating relationships with partner institutes. In 2011 involved in the preparations for the 20th anniversary in collaboration with TAFA University of Art and Design in Tianjin, China. Co-curator 'Dürer was also here': AIAS in-between workshop and exhibition in Museum PAN in Emmerich with participants from 13 countries; 2006. Responsible for the international coordination of the workshop and the production of the exhibition catalog in collaboration with ArtEZ. 

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
profile_positions.title: chief ambassador AIAS (Association of Independent Art and Design Schools) 2006 - 2012

profile_positions.description: Artist and professor Fine Arts at ArtEZ School of Art & Design Enschede, The Netherlands. Performative installations, object art and photography.
profile_positions.title: Art Educator

profile_positions.description:
MBASSY UNLIMITED is an independent alliance for contemporary art & culture founded by visual artist Margret Wibmer, that initiates transcultural and transdisciplinary collaborations. 

MBUs mission is to communicate and to ignite a new dialogue from the artists perspective relating to a broadening audience in light of an increasing global interconnection.

Next to international collaborations, MBU organizes local events that provide expertise and tools for looking at contemporary art in a friendly and informal atmosphere.  
During these 'conversations with artists' emerging visual artists are introduced who's work engenders multiple disciplines and areas of knowledge, while inventing or adapting new production methods. 

It is from these artists’ viewpoint as inquisitive minds, who dare to negotiate their position regardless of the art canon and the art market steered by commercial interests, that we can experience and gain understanding of changes in today's society. 

Past events have been hosted and supported by the Austrian Embassy, the Vlaamse Vergetenwoordiging/Belgian Embassy, GEMAK and the American Embassy, all located in The Hague.
profile_positions.title: Creator/director

profile_positions.description: Second Sight is a network based organization, a publisher and a lab about trend research and trendforecasting. With its quarterly magazine Second Sight provides an ongoing research into the spirit of our times.
profile_positions.title: jury member Twoty Awards, category fashion and design
